title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Summary
I have been fortunate to work across a range of clinical and research environments that have shaped both my research interests and professional perspective. Through this work, I have gained exposure to diverse clinical conditions, research methodologies, and healthcare practices, and have developed a strong appreciation for how research translates into real-world patient care.
What I find most rewarding is working collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams to bring ideas together and contribute to evidence-based care that can make a meaningful difference for patients.
Below is a summary of my experience, skills, and recognitions so far, which I look forward to continuing to build as my training and career progress.

title: Sobhan Mardan
text:
Pharmacoepidemiology R Causal Inference Real-World Evidence
Turning real-world health data into drug safety insights
PhD Student @ UBC | Research Coordinator @ Vancouver General Hospital
I am a PhD student in Pharmaceutical Sciences specializing in pharmacoepidemiology where I evaluate the real-world effectiveness and safety of drug therapies.
For my doctoral research, I am studying oral anti-coagulation (OAC) therapy in patients with atrial fibrillation (AF). Using causal inference methods applied to observational data, I examine whether patients’ frailty status modifies the effectiveness of OAC, with a focus on clinically important outcomes such as stroke and mortality.
